title.value: Health satisfaction outcome from integrated autonomous mobile clinics
title.justification: The title is extracted directly from the beginning of the paper, which explicitly names the research study.
title.quote: Health satisfaction outcome from integrated autonomous mobile clinics

extractions.description: The paper investigates the effectiveness of integrated care delivery through Autonomous Mobile Clinics (AMCs) on health satisfaction outcomes, especially focusing on integrating AMCs into existing healthcare systems, using a study conducted with United Family Healthcare.

type.justification: This is evident from the methodology described, involving a study with 200 patients, utilizing AMCs and comparing outcomes with usual care methods.
type.quote: To understand the effectiveness of AMCs as a revolutionary way of healthcare service delivery, we have conducted a study with the UFH group.

name.justification: The research is focused on the integration of Autonomous Mobile Clinics and digital health technologies such as telemedicine and electronic health records.
name.quote: Keywords Digital health, Integrated care, Autonomous driving, AI for health

name.justification: The paper involves the use of AI systems within the AMCs to enhance healthcare delivery.
name.quote: Keywords Digital health, Integrated care, Autonomous driving, AI for health

name.justification: The paper heavily discusses telemedicine as one of the enabling technologies for AMCs, focusing on remote doctor-patient interactions.
name.quote: Telemedicine: network connectivity is key to guaranteeing the Quality-of-Service (QoS) of telemedicine applications.
